results.title: Withdrawal behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Gesa de Rozner, P. Hefferman-Cabera and Science Research Association
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
Withdrawal is a response to overwhelming threat to identity. This film looks at behaviour in the classroom which can produce a withdrawal in both students and teachers, and indicates how to recognise this behaviour when it is occurring.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gesa de Rozner, P. Hefferman-Cabera and Science Research Association

results.title: Supporting behavior (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phil Content, Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera and Science Research Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”
We all need others to add their strength to our own. In the classroom pupils need support and guidance from teachers to give them the power to cope. A good teacher manages the classroom so that everyone gets a chance to express himself and grow.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Content, Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera and Science Research Associates

results.title: Reciprocating behavior (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera, Phil Content and Science Research Association
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
Because we are all dependent on each other, a voluntary exchange of personal ideas and emotions allows us to develop as individuals. Reciprocating behaviour in the classroom enables the pupils to develop, to become both receiver and giver.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera, Phil Content and Science Research Association

results.title: Training mannikin
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”
Intended mainly for first aid instructors but also of interest to first aid classes, the various ways in which a manikin may be used to train a class to perform both exhaled air resuscitation and closed chest cardiac massage are demonstrated by an instructor and his pupils. Care and maintenance of the manikin is illustrated as well as the hygienic precautions taken to safeguard users.

results.title: Seconds count
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”

A realistic and dramatic series of incidents likely to be met in service and civilian life, where exhaled air resuscitation may be the quickest or only way of saving life. Emphasises how important it is for the victims, once breathing has restarted, to be taken to hospital for further observations.

results.title: Clockworks
results.creator_credit: Kent Stetson, Niall Burnett and Points East Productions
results.brief_description: Story about a Down’s syndrome child who eventually finds useful part-time employment with a clock repairer. Raises issues surrounding prejudice against the employment of the disabled.

results.title: Climbing to Success
results.brief_description: A documentary about the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award Scheme. This is a scheme that combines various skills with the intention of working towards community-orientated goals. No other credits available
